title: What to do
steps: Seek help from your Store Manager if you are unsure.
Do not ask anyone to cover themselves.
Do not ask anyone to stop breastfeeding or expressing anywhere in our stores.
examples: Sometimes, other customers will take offence to seeing a mother breastfeeding or expressing in one of our stores.
caveats: This includes in fitting rooms or on the shop floor.
constraints: Breastfeeding welcome here. It's not just inclusion, it's the law.
In Australian Federal Law, breastfeeding is a right, not a privilege.
Under the federal Sex Discrimination Act 1984 it is illegal in Australia to discriminate against a person either directly or indirectly on the grounds of breastfeeding.
This means, a woman has the right to breastfeed, or express milk, anywhere she chooses.
troubleshooting: If you receive a complaint from a customer you may advise them that this is a women's right under Australian Federal Law.
If you are uncomfortable, unsure, or if the complaint escalates seek help from your Store Manager.
